職稱: 分子醫學研究所 教授
學歷: 明尼蘇達大學 遺傳學所 博士(美國 7509 - 8210)
國立中興大學(臺中) 食品科學系 學士(中華民國 7009 - 7406)
專長及研究領域:
Tumor angiogenesis, oral carcinogenesis, DNA microarray
我目前的研究方向主要有三: 
(1)探討調控血管新生有關之基因及其作用的分子機轉。藉由了解其分子機制，渴望協助新藥發展及對因angiogenesis失控的疾病作有效治療。
(2)口腔癌於近年來雖已躍居十大癌症死因第五位，其致病機制仍不清楚。之前本實驗室已利用微矩陣DNA晶片找到幾個與口腔癌形成有關的Candidate基因，目前正利用動物模式及分子細胞生物等技術探討其作用機轉；此外希望利用動物模式探討Angiogenesis在口腔癌所扮演的角色 ，並進一步探討結合抗血管新生療法與現有的癌症治療在治療口腔癌可能性。
(3)透過與中研院及香港中文大學合作，由傳統中草藥粹取物尋求新穎血管新生抑制劑並探討其抑制機轉。

專長及研究領域:
分子生物及細胞生物
磷酸
　Reversible phosphorylation is a crucial modification regulating signal transduction in many cellular processes in eukaryotic cells. The state of protein phosphorylation is a consequence of integrated actions of both protein kinases and protein phosphatases. Regulation of signaling cascades by protein serine/threonine kinases has been well established, whereas regulation by protein serine/threonine phosphatases has yet to be elucidated. 
　Protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A) is one of the major serine/ threonine phosphatases in mammalian cells involved in regulating multiple cellular processes including DNA replication and repair, protein synthesis, cell cycle progression, and apoptosis. PP2A is a heterotrimeric enzyme which consists of a scaffold subunit A, a catalytic subunit C, and a variable regulatory subunit B. PP2A is known to be regulated by post-translational modifications and by association with regulatory molecules. 
　Our research is focused on elucidating how the regulatory B subunit controls the substrate specificity and subcellular localization of the PP2A holoenzyme and on investigating the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying the tumor suppression function of PP2A. Three main topics are currently pursued in my laboratory. First of all, we are developing tools for distinguishing the subcellular localization of the PP2A holoenzyme and substrate specificity regulated by different B subunits. Second, we are dissecting the mechanism of nuclear-cytoplasmic shuttling of PP2A controlled by the regulatory subunit B56 family and its impact on controlling cell cycle progression. Third, we are investigating the role of PP2A in tumorigenesis, especially esophageal cancer. We apply technology of biochemistry, recombinant DNA, fluorescence imaging and proteomics to address the PP2A-regulated cellular functions.

　 instability), 以及篩選含防癌的食品和藥物。

專長及研究領域:
病毒疫苗，T細胞及黏膜免疫，細胞生化及分子遺傳，高等微生物及病毒學，蛋白質體學在感染性疾病的運用.
我目前進行的實驗計畫有:
 (1) 愛滋病疫苗發展與粘膜免疫。
 (2) 確認愛滋病病毒的結構蛋白Gag在細胞運輸時，與核酸鞘蛋白(Nucleocapsid)有交互作用的寄主蛋白網路。
 (3) 蛋白質體學運用與分析C型肝炎病毒(HCV)核蛋白(Core)在肝細胞及免疫細胞內作用的蛋白網路。
 (4) HIV與HCV 綜合載體在疫苗及基因傳輸的應用
 (5) A型流感病毒NS1蛋白拮抗細胞激素造成高毒力之功能性細胞網路的探索:反向遺傳系統及蛋白質體學的策略應用
 (6) 利用掛鎖探針有效檢測第一型人類後天免疫缺乏病毒陽性孕婦之新生兒
 (7)南台灣HIV流行病毒學與抗性監測
　
我的長遠目標在:
(1)瞭解亞洲流行性病毒的致病機制:以HIV/SIV為例，探究被病毒感染的Dendritic cell, Macrophage及T cell如何更改其基因網路，將運用Gene chips及 Flow cytometry來探討問題。
(2)找出對抗或幫助病毒繁殖的寄主蛋白因子:比較細胞蛋白質在接受性及非接受性細胞對病毒蛋白的親和性，以找出能限制病毒侵入、組裝、遺傳物質包裝、或複製的細胞因子。將採用Tandem affinity purification for protein complex (Tap-tag) 與 Mass spectrometry的技術，找出與病毒蛋白有交互作用的寄主蛋白網路。
